title: Tom Hardy reveals Sean Penn was lined up to play his The Revenant character
title_page: Tom Hardy reveals Sean Penn was lined up to play his The Revenant character | Daily Mail Online
text:
He's received his first Oscar nomination for his role as the villainous John Fitzgerald in The Revenant.
But things could have been a lot different for Tom Hardy, 38, had Sean Penn, 55, taken the role as originally planned.
In an interview with Latin TV channel De Película, Hardy revealed: 'Leo called me up because Sean Penn initially was to play Fitzgerald.

'Then [Penn] was unavailable. I was going to be doing [the film] Splinter Cell. Leo called me up and said, "I’m doing this film with Alejandro [Iñárritu]. It’s really cool.”'
Hardy has received critical acclaim for his role in the award-winning picture and narrowly missed out on a Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor to Sylvester Stallone for his turn in Creed.
The actor is experiencing the most successful period of his career to date with Mad Max: Fury Road and The Revenant both nominated for Best Picture at the Oscars, and his dual performances as Reggie and Ronnie Kray in Legend earned him rave reviews.

Hollywood hunks: Hardy at The Revenant's London premiere alongside co-star Leonardo DiCaprio
And when asked by Screen Slam for his reaction to that success, he admitted: 'I don't think about things like that. That's really cool. It was really lovely the movies get recognised in that way. I think that's fantastic.'
The Revenant has so far amassed more than $220 million at the box office globally, and it was the number one film in the world last weekend taking in $33.8 million.
Filming the rural survival tale took 11 months, with crew and cast battling the elements to produce the visually-stunning production.
Global smash: The Revenant has so far amassed more than $220 million at the box office globally, and it was the number one film in the world last weekend taking in $33.8 million
With an incredible 93 per cent of the film being shot outside and not on a green screen, the film-makers were pushed to their limits to capture the rugged landscape.
Set in the 1820s and based on real life events, The Revenant tells the story of fur-trapper Hugh Glass, who was left for dead by his hunting party following a brutal bear attack.
The film follows Glass as he tries to gain revenge on the men who betrayed him.
It is believed Leonardo DiCaprio's show-stopping performance as Glass will land him his first Oscar, with the film up for a total haul of 12 Academy Awards.
